market_context: US stock futures are sliding lower on February 27, 2026, with S&P 500 futures down 0.2-0.35%, Nasdaq 100 futures down 0.30%, and Dow futures down 0.50%, primarily due to Nvidia's 5-5.5% after-hours drop despite strong earnings, raising tech valuation concerns.[1][3][5] Netflix shares rallied 9-11% in after-hours after dropping its bid for Warner Bros. Discovery, seen as financially prudent, while pre-market movers like Accenture (+8.29%) and TKO Group (+8.01%) show selective strength.[1][3][4] Mixed signals include lower mortgage rates at 5.98% and improving Kansas Fed Manufacturing Index at 10, amid broader caution from macroeconomic risks and VIX spike.[3]

predictions.reasoning: S&P 500 futures are down 0.2-0.35% amid Nvidia's 5.5% plunge post-earnings, dragging tech-heavy indexes with Nasdaq futures off 0.30%.[1][3][5] Broader risk pullback and VIX spike suggest continued pressure, outweighing mixed positives like lower mortgage rates.[3][4] Assumes ~0.4% decline from recent levels.

Nasdaq 100 futures down 0.30% following Nvidia's sharp drop and tech sector weakness, with Microsoft and Salesforce also declining in extended trading.[1][5] AI valuation skepticism post-earnings weighs heavily on QQQ's tech composition.[1] Projects modest further downside to align with futures momentum.

Netflix surged 9-11% in after-hours after withdrawing from Warner Bros. bidding war, viewed as strategic relief with potential $28B fee and share repurchases resuming.[1][4] Oversold RSI signals rebound potential despite margin pressures.[1] Strong catalyst likely sustains gains against broader market weakness.

Nvidia dropped over 5% after-hours despite record profits, due to investor skepticism on AI infrastructure sustaining growth amid high valuations.[1] Contributed to Nasdaq futures decline of 0.30% and broader tech pullback.[1][5] Sell-the-news reaction may extend into regular session.

Accenture up 8.29% pre-market on multi-year AI collaboration with Mistral AI, providing positive counter to tech sector woes.[3] Earnings-driven momentum in AI services could persist amid sector rotation away from chips.[1][3]
